title: Bang Mo Volcano
description: Located on the 'Symphony of New Winds' tourist route, Bang Mo Volcano is a geological experience, where visitors can explore the timeless marks of Earth's geological history on this M'nông plateau.|||Bang Mo Volcano (formerly known as Ea T'Linh Volcano) is situated in Ea T'Linh town, Cư Jút district. It is a young volcano, typical of central eruption type, dating back 200,000 to 600,000 years.|||The Bang Mo Volcano crater is well-preserved with a relatively round shape; approximately 242m in diameter, 40m high, with a 15-degree slope, and at an elevation of 407m above sea level. The surrounding area features scattered volcanic ash, rocks, and bombs.|||From the base of the volcano, it takes about 30 minutes to climb to the crater. The gentle slope makes it suitable for visitors of all ages. From the resting point at the summit, the panoramic view of Ea T'Linh town's peaceful and prosperous landscape is breathtaking. Bang Mo Volcano promises to be a fascinating and unique destination for travelers.

title: Thác đá Granite
description: Trong khi tỉnh Đắk Nông được bao phủ chủ yếu bởi đất, đá trầm tích (được hình thành trong môi trường đại dương) và đất, đá bazan (hình thành khi xuất hiện hoạt động của núi lửa) thì tại Vườn Quốc gia Tà Đùng lại sở hữu những khối đá xâm nhập granite, thể hiện một quá trình hoạt động địa chất rất đa dạng và phức tạp của Công viên địa chất toàn cầu UNESCO Đắk Nông.|||Đá granite là loại đá sáng màu có nguồn gốc từ nham thạch với các hạt đủ lớn để nhìn thấy bằng mắt thường. Loại đá này được hình thành từ quá trình kết tinh chậm dung nham dưới bề mặt trái đất. Đá granite chủ yếu được cấu tạo bằng thạnh anh và felspat với một lượng nhỏ mica, khoáng vật silicat và các khoáng vật khác.|||Rất ít người biết rằng, cũng tại nơi đây, có một thác nước rất đặc biệt và độc đáo với dòng chảy bao phủ lên những khối đá granite, được các nhà khoa học đặt tên là Thác đá granite. Trong khi đó, người dân địa phương thường gọi thác nước này là thác “Trượt” vì độ trơn nhẵn và sáng bóng của các khối đá trong lòng thác. Hiện có rất ít Công viên địa chất toàn cầu UNESCO trên thế giới sở hữu loại thác đá granite tương tự.|||Thác đá granite nằm ẩn mình trong khu rừng già tại xã Đắk Som, huyện Đắk G’long. Từ Quốc lộ 28, để đến được thác, cần đi bộ khoảng 1 km theo hướng bảng chỉ dẫn của Công viên địa chất toàn cầu UNESCO Đắk Nông. Dọc tuyến đi bộ này, du khách có cơ hội được tận hưởng không khí mát mẻ, trong lành và ngắm nhìn cảnh quang thiên nhiên hoang sơ, tươi đẹp dọc hai bên đường. Điểm tham quan thác cũng đã được huyện đầu tư xây dựng chòi ngắm cảnh để quan sát toàn cảnh vẻ đẹp thơ mộng của khu vực thác đá granite.|||Tuy là một thác nước nhỏ nhưng nơi đây lại là địa điểm linh thiêng, nơi diễn ra các hoạt động sinh hoạt cộng đồng của người dân địa phương, như các buổi lễ cúng thần linh của người đồng bào dân tộc Mạ từ bao đời nay để cầu cho mưa thuận gió hòa, mùa màng tốt tươi.|||Là một điểm tham quan trên tuyến Âm vang từ Trái đất, thác nước granite thơ mộng nổi bật trên quang cảnh thiên nhiên hùng vĩ của núi rừng Tà Đùng chắc chắn là một điểm đến hấp dẫn, không thể bỏ qua đối với những du khách ưu khám phá, mạo hiểm.

title: Chợ nổi Trà Ôn
description: Nếu muốn tìm hiểu đặc sắc văn hóa sinh hoạt của người dân Vĩnh Long, hãy đến chợ nổi Trà Ôn. Cách vàm Trà Ôn 250m, chợ nổi ở hạ lưu sông Hậu có chiều dài trên 300m, thường họp theo con nước nên nước lớn thì chợ đông.|||Chợ nổi Trà Ôn mang tính chất của một chợ đầu mối phân phối nông sản cho nhiều chợ nhỏ khác trong tỉnh. Bởi vậy nên dù ghé chợ trong ngày vào bất kì thời điểm nào trong ngày cũng thấy tấp nập những thuyền ghe.|||Điểm xuyết trong vô số thuyền chở cây trái đủ màu sắc là những ghe bán hoa kiểng trang trí nhiều màu, tạo nên những khoảnh khắc rất “tình” trong nhịp điệu buôn bán sôi nổi.

title: Long An Ancient Pagoda
description: Long An Ancient Pagoda, built in the late 19th century by the devout Lam family, who donated 30 acres of land to construct the pagoda and its surrounding fields. For centuries, it has been a resting place for renowned Buddhist monks from the southern region, including Khanh Anh, Hue Quang, Khanh Hoa, and Phap Hai, who established the Academic Association to promote the correct teachings of Buddhism and spread national language education.|||Upon entering Long An Ancient Pagoda, monks, Buddhists, and visitors feel as though they have entered a serene and happy haven, where chanting helps people escape worldly worries.

title: Hoang Hao Eco-Tourism Area
description: For those seeking a peaceful retreat to the countryside, surrounded by fresh air and savory local dishes, Hoang Hao Eco-Tourism Area is an ideal choice.|||Located on National Route 57, 2 km from Dinh Khao ferry, Hoang Hao ecotourism area is in Thanh Duc commune, Long Ho district, Vinh Long province. Hoang Hao is a brand-new, stunning ecotourism destination in Vinh Long, boasting not only lush green landscapes but also incredibly fresh air.|||Despite opening in 2019, it has quickly become an ideal spot for entertainment, leisure, and relaxation for people of all backgrounds in Vĩnh Long and tourists visiting the Mekong Delta region.|||The entire campus of Hoàng Hảo is surrounded by a vast green forest, giving the impression of a secluded oasis deep in the woods when viewed from above. Visiting Hoàng Hảo allows you to fully immerse in the serene and peaceful atmosphere of the Western river region.|||The space at Hoang Hao tourist area is designed with a rich Mekong Delta (Miền Tây) garden style, featuring small streams resembling mini rivers that flow throughout the entire area. The two banks are connected by unique and exciting monkey bridges.||||||Covering an area of nearly 68 hectares, Hoang Hao Vĩnh Long Ecotourism offers a wide range of exciting entertainment services suitable for both adults and children.|||At Hoang Hao ecological tourist site, visitors can immerse themselves in the pristine natural scenery and participate in rustic activities like fishing, rowing, catching fish in the ditch, catching ducks, and catching frogs. For the adventurous, there's the thrill of cycling across wooden bridges or crossing monkey bridges and enjoying many other games in the complex playground.|||Two popular games that tourists love at the resort village are Zorbing – where a large ball rolls down a gentle grassy slope and a colorful water ball rolling game.|||With its large area and open space, the Hoàng Hảo (Royal Gem) eco-tourism site is also an ideal location for team building, camping, picnics, outdoor activities, and experiential learning.|||Hoang Hao also features a mini house area for overnight stays, catering to the needs of tourists. The mini houses are thatched with straw roofs or tin roofs, and their lower parts are adorned with vibrant, brightly colored walls.|||In front of the mini house row lies a vast lotus pond. The lake is covered with lotus plants, and when the lotus flowers bloom, the area is enveloped in a soft pink hue and a sweet fragrance, creating a romantic atmosphere.|||After a day of outdoor games at Hoàng Hảo, you can unwind in a mini house within the resort, surrounded by nature. Each morning, wake up to fresh air, watch lotus flowers bloom, and listen to birds singing in the distance. It's a truly idyllic life, harmonious with nature.|||When visiting the Hoang Hao tourist area, don't forget to stop by the super-wide restaurant located within the Hoang Hao eco-tourism complex to savor the distinctive dishes of the Western Region.|||The space here is incredibly airy thanks to its harmonious design with nature. You can try signature dishes like grilled chicken rice, savory pancakes, southern fermented fish hotpot, crispy fried catfish, pickled lotus stem, and lotus stem cake, all of which boast the irresistible flavor of the riverine region that will leave you craving for more after just one try. Especially, adventurous travelers will delight in thrilling moments, feeling refreshed as they watch catfish jumping out of the water to catch bait, and can even try their hand at making traditional southern cakes like savory pancakes, mini savory pancakes, or leaf-wrapped cakes.

title: Vinh Sang Tourist Area
description: Looking for a group entertainment spot in Vinh Long, many would point you to Vinh Sang eco-tourism area. Vinh Sang Farm is triangular in shape, with a prime location along the Co Chien River, opposite Vinh Long City.|||Perhaps nowhere else offers the chance to see as many rare animals as this tourist area, including bears, goats, egrets, snakes, monitor lizards, deer, pigs, pink-cheeked monkeys, macaques, peacocks, and more. The 200m2 crocodile farm at Vinh Sang is a haven for thrill-seekers.|||Despite its unique features, the area still feels cozy and intimate, like a traditional Southern Vietnamese garden. The spacious and airy environment is perfect for lively activities like grass sliding, shooting, cockfighting, ball throwing, blindfolded ostrich feather sticking, and fishing competitions. For those who prefer a quieter experience, individual travelers can enjoy the peaceful atmosphere in the fishing huts.|||The entrance fee to Vinh Sang Tourist Area is very reasonable: 50,000 VND for adults and 35,000 VND for children (from 5 to 11 years old or under 1.2m tall). If you buy a tour ticket on Fridays, you'll get free access to crocodile fishing, ostrich riding, and duck pedaling.

title: Ancient House Eco-Area
description: The Ancient House Eco-Area is a Vĩnh Long tourist destination that evokes the strongest sense of nostalgia in visitors. It's called an eco-area because, aside from the aged house, it's surrounded by ornamental trees and fruit gardens that create a harmonious, green atmosphere.|||Even those unfamiliar with architecture can't help but marvel at the intricate carvings of birds, flowers, and other motifs. The entire ancient house is made of precious wood and has a history that spans more years than the combined ages of a group of tourists.

title: Bung Binh Thien
description: Bung Binh Thien is a serene lake with crystal-clear waters, offering a picturesque landscape in An Giang perfect for camping, picnics, and fishing. Visitors can take a leisurely boat ride around the lake, and there are fishing huts and eateries to stop and relax. This is an ideal rustic getaway in An Giang for couples looking for a romantic escape.

title: Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai
description: One of the unmentioned attractions is that Ben Tre also draws visitors with Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai. This spot still boasts its pristine beauty with a stretch of white sand and rows of green trees swaying gently in the breeze. Certainly, visiting this place will give tourists wonderful and exciting experiences.|||Thua Duc Beach is known for its peaceful and serene atmosphere, with its pristine beauty and rows of palm trees shading the road. The sound of waves and the gentle rustling of the wind create a symphony of sounds that are hard to resist.|||Thua Duc Beach is a natural beach located in Binh Dai District, Ben Tre Province. It stretches about 8km long and is over 60 km from Ben Tre City. This place has a cool and fresh climate, attracting many tourists to visit each year.|||Thua Duc Beach is a beach with pristine and attractive beauty. The sea water has waves rolling in, and the shore is lined with fine, long sand. The sounds of the wind, trees, and waves all blend together in a harmonious melody of Thua Duc. A gentle and enticing tune that draws in tourists.|||The area has a cool and fresh climate, making it ideal for visiting and relaxing. Each year, over 12,000 tourists visit, and Ben Tre Province is working to develop Thua Duc Beach into a prominent tourist destination, aiming to attract 50,000 to 70,000 visitors annually.|||Not only is the place beautiful and attractive, but it is also a rich area for seafood like clams, mussels, snails, and crabs. Furthermore, it is famous for its delicious banh xeo. Perhaps, only by visiting can tourists fully appreciate the taste of the seafood and the rich flavor of banh xeo, a local specialty.|||The unique taste of the local cuisine is a special thing that leaves an impression on tourists visiting Thua Duc. By coming to this beautiful and poetic beach, tourists can visit, swim, rest, relax, and enjoy the local food culture with many delicious dishes.|||Thua Duc Beach in Binh Dai promises to bring the most exciting experiences to tourists. This place is also being invested in and developed, so it will certainly become a wonderful destination for tourists in the future.

title: Orchid King Tourist Area
description: Just 5km from the center of Ben Tre city, the Orchid King Tourist Area is an ideal destination for relaxation and entertainment, chosen by many. Visitors can immerse themselves in the cool natural surroundings and enjoy fun activities like rope bridges, zip lines, and monkey bridges.|||In addition to exciting games, the Orchid King Tourist Area also offers a range of tourism services, including restaurants, farmstays, camping, and more. If you're looking for a great spot in Ben Tre to have fun with family and friends, the Orchid King Tourist Area is an excellent choice.

title: Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village
description: Getting to the Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village is straightforward. Starting from Saigon, simply cross Rạch Miễu Bridge, turn left for about 700m to Cá Chuối Bridge. Once you've crossed this bridge, you'll have arrived at this famous eco-tourism site.|||Visitors to the Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village will undoubtedly be thrilled and delighted by the authentic Southern Vietnamese natural scenery and unique organizational style. This destination truly deserves to be one of the most impressive tourist spots in the Western region, leaving an unforgettable impression on visitors.|||One of the exciting experiences here is dressing up in traditional Southern Vietnamese attire, known as bà ba. You can also participate in various folk games like monkey bridge crossing, coconut tree climbing, balance bike riding, fish catching, and rope crossing.|||Additionally, you can try your hand at making clay firecrackers or cooking traditional garden dishes with your friends, which promises to be an extremely exciting and appealing experience.|||Upon arriving at the Hamlet Eco-Tourism Village, you'll be impressed by the picturesque and romantic natural scenery of the riverine countryside. A special highlight of this place is the traditional floating villages of the local people. The atmosphere is serene and peaceful, making anyone who visits feel light and carefree, shedding all worries of daily life.|||Try sitting on a small boat, drifting along the winding rivers, or letting your spirit roam free with the water of the Western region, savoring the fresh and enticing fruits. These will be wonderful moments that you won't want to forget for a single second.

title: Phu Da Sandbar
description: Located about 100km from Ho Chi Minh City, Phu Da Sandbar is an ideal destination for city dwellers to explore on weekends. If traveling by motorbike, follow this route: Start from Ho Chi Minh City, head towards the Western region on National Highway 1A, then cross My Thuan Bridge and continue on National Highway 53, and finally take the Pham Hung road to An Binh ferry terminal. From there, take a boat to Phu Da Sandbar.|||Phu Da Sandbar is an eco-tourism destination with a romantic and serene natural landscape, featuring Phu Da Temple, a spiritual site for the locals. Be sure to try the specialty of Phu Da Sandbar – Phu Da snail.|||Phu Da snails are sold in markets all over the sandbar|||According to Mr. Ba Ngoi, a local, Phu Da snails are at their best around May in the Lunar Calendar, with a sweet and rich flavor. After being caught, they are prepared into various dishes like stir-fried snails with lemongrass and chili, boiled snails, or used as an ingredient in salads and pancakes. In Phu Da Sandbar, snails are sold in all markets, and visitors can find them at affordable prices.|||After enjoying the specialty snails, visitors can continue their journey by engaging in activities like rowing, fishing, and exploring the lush orchards. Next, they should visit Phu Da Temple to pray for peace and prosperity and explore the famous Miếu Bà Chúa Xứ temple, known for its miraculous granting of wishes.|||And experience a boat trip to explore the sandbar|||In Ben Tre, aside from Phu Da Sandbar, visitors can also explore Phung Sandbar, Tien Sandbar, or Thoi Son Islet to discover the unique beauty of the Western region.

title: Tua Hai Historical and Cultural Victory Site
description: Located in Tua Hai hamlet, Dong Khoi commune, Chau Thanh district, Tay Ninh province, on highway 22B, 7km northwest of Tay Ninh city.|||Tua Hai was the name of a French watchtower, later expanded by the US and puppet government into a major military base. By 1960, it served as a reserve arms depot for all three tactical zones of the enemy. The site included the 32nd Battalion of the 13th Division, a special forces training school, a rapid response battalion, and two reconnaissance companies embedded among the locals.|||On the night of January 25, 1960, the people and armed forces of Tay Ninh, along with other secret forces from the region, launched a surprise attack on the enemy's headquarters at Tua Hai. This battle marked the beginning of the armed Dong Khoi movement across South Vietnam.|||The site was recognized by the Ministry of Culture and Information (now the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism) as the Tua Hai Historical Victory Site in Decision 937/QD-BT on September 23, 1993.|||

title: Long Dien Son Tourist Area
description: Located about 5km from the center of Tay Ninh City and 3km from Nui Ba Den (Black Lady Mountain) Tourist Area, Long Dien Son is a must-visit destination when visiting Tay Ninh. The area stands out with its vast, open space and picturesque landscape, along with a water park offering many exciting games for those traveling with friends and family to relax.|||Long Dien Son Water Park covers an area of over 2 hectares and is currently the largest and only water park in Tay Ninh Province. When visiting, you can try thrilling games like water slides, artificial wave pools,... or areas dedicated to children for family trips.

title: Ma Thien Lanh Tourist Area
description: Located in Thanh Tan commune, Tay Ninh town, Ma Thien Lanh is formed by three mountains: Ba Den Mountain, Heo Mountain, and Phung Mountain.|||The area features hundreds of hectares of pristine forest and streams that flow gently, creating a mystical, wild, and dreamy atmosphere.|||To reach this tourist area, you'll travel on a paved road over 3km from provincial road 785 to Phung Mountain and then to Ma Thien Lanh. However, as its name suggests, the road is quite steep and treacherous. Therefore, before heading out, make sure to prepare thoroughly, both physically and mentally, to ensure a safe journey to Ma Thien Lanh.|||After overcoming the challenging road, Ma Thien Lanh will reward your efforts, allowing you to immerse yourself in the pristine, breathtaking, and peaceful scenery of the area, which remains largely untouched by human hands.

title: Sala Entertainment Complex
description: Located in the heart of the city, on a bustling avenue, Sala is a must-visit destination that will leave you wanting more. This complex offers a range of activities, including entertainment, dining, and accommodation, making it perfect for a relaxing getaway or a fun outing with friends, colleagues, or family.|||The vast Sala Amusement Park features a wide range of services, allowing you to have an unforgettable experience without wanting to leave. With its modern, youthful design and elegant, traditional touches, the architecture boasts sleek lines, A-shaped roofs, and a vibrant, harmonious color palette reminiscent of Southeast Asia.
